result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant in court today w/Atty Teesch, hearing requested by Atty Teesch ref inability to pay. Testimony taken from defendant. Assist DA Nicholas Grode appeared for the State. Judge finds defendant physically able to work so had the ability to pay financial obligations to the court. Judge stays remaining commitment, orders defendant to be released, will need to start $100 per month payments within 30 days of release.
from Atty Teesch requesting a hearing on ability to pay

Appeared before Judge

Defendant in custody and appeared by video conference from the jail.  Currently owes $6,178.16 in fines, last payment made was in August 2015. Defendant started working a part-time job a couple of weeks ago and has a lead on a full-time landscaping job.  He currently has a couple hundred dollars to his name.  Judge states defendant has to pay at least $2,000.00 towards his fines in order to be released from custody and is ordered to pay a minimum of $200/month on his fines.  Defendant reiterates he has no money. He will sit his time (248 days). Judge asked for current address---defendant stated he "WAS" living at 1415 12th Avenue in Sheboygan and is looking for a new place.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gregory A Brown in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.   State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Gregory A Brown appeared by video from Sheboygan County Jail. Attorney Brett E Reetz appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises that Defendant is going through probation revocation in Sheboygan County. Defense has recently been appointed. Discussion regarding appearance by video unless case is resolved, in which case State will issue writ. Bond continues as is. Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Change of Attorney
from State to Court requesting video from Sheboygan County Jail for 5/23 hearing. Per Court, video or phone is okay except for plea or trial.

Defendant Gregory A Brown in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson. Defendant Gregory A Brown in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that revocation proceeding is resolved, Defendant will have to return to Sheboygan. Defense moves to withdraw, advises that PD's office is currently looking for new counsel. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
